Context:
The text mentions a construction program at the Angelo DelZotto School of Construction Management. Students in this program are required to complete semester 2 in the summer after their first semester to continue into semester 3 in the fall.

Graduates from this program can enter the industry as construction technicians, site managers, project and construction managers, estimators, home builders, general contractors, building and home inspectors, or sales agents. The construction industry generates a large number of jobs and wages in Ontario and Canada, with a high demand for educated and skilled workers.

Students have the option to continue into the third year of the Construction Engineering Technology Program (T105) for an Advanced Diploma after their fourth semester. They can also transfer to the Honours Bachelor of Technology (Construction Management) degree program with a minimum GPA of 3.0 after completing the three-year Construction Engineering Technology program.

The text mentions that the courses in this program are currently under review and changes are expected starting from the 2023-24 year. The required first-semester course is BLDG 1025: Construction Field Practices.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Construction Engineering Technician Program T161 | George Brown College2023.txt

The text ends by listing some general education electives and their detailed course outlines and program learning outcomes.

Context:
The graduate of the construction engineering program at George Brown College is expected to:
- Develop strategies for professional growth and ongoing learning in construction engineering.
- Comply with workplace health and safety practices and procedures.
- Complete duties in accordance with contractual obligations, applicable laws, standards, bylaws, codes, and ethical practices.
- Carry out sustainability practices in accordance with contract documents, industry standards, and environmental legislative requirements.
- Collaborate with project stakeholders and facilitate communication.
- Collect, process, and interpret technical data to produce project-related documents.
- Contribute to the collecting, interpreting, and applying of survey/geomatics and layout information.
- Identify and use industry-specific electronic and digital technologies.
- Contribute to resolving technical problems by applying engineering concepts, basic technical mathematics, and building science.
- Assist in scheduling and monitoring construction projects.
- Prepare accurate estimates of time, cost, quality, and quantity, tenders, and bids.
- Perform quality control testing and monitoring of equipment, materials, and methods.
- Apply teamwork, leadership, and interpersonal skills.

Tuition fees for the first two semesters of programs starting in Fall 2022:
- Domestic students: $3,928.00
- International students: $17,545.00

Fees are subject to change for programs starting in Fall 2023 and at later dates. International students should visit the International Fees and Related Costs page for more information.

The program is approved for OSAP funding for applicants who meet eligibility criteria.

Disclaimer: Information on this website is subject to change without notice. It should not be considered a representation, offer, or warranty. Students are responsible for verifying the accuracy of George Brown College information.

Context:
Extracted Information:

1. Applicants are required to have an Ontario Secondary School Diploma or equivalent.
2. Grade 12 English (C or U) and grade 11 math (M or U) or grade 12 (C or U) are required for admission.
3. Mature students (19 years of age or older and no OSSD) need to take the Admissions Assessment for English and math, or upgrade their credits in English and math.
4. George Brown College is committed to ensuring that applicants will succeed in their program of choice, but meeting minimum requirements does not guarantee admission.
5. Applicants may be required to have grades higher than the minimum requirements stated.
6. Course exemptions can be obtained through college or university credits. More information can be found on the Transfer Guide.
7. International students should refer to the International Admissions page for country-specific admission requirements.
8. The Angelo DelZotto School of Construction Management strongly recommends that students own or purchase a laptop and arrange for home internet service with 25 to 40 Mbps and a ping time of 20–100 ms.
9. Laptop specifications should meet the following: operating system (Windows 10 Home 64-bit English), processor (9th Generation Intel® Core™ i7-9750H), memory (RAM: 16GB DDR4 2666MHz), disk space (256GB M.2 PCIe NVMe Solid State Drive and 1TB 5400 rpm 2.5" SATA Hard Drive), display card (NVIDIA® GeForce RTX™ 2060), connectivity (802.11ac WiFi and Bluetooth, 2 x 2 ports), screen size (minimum 15.6 inch FHD(1920 x 1080) IPS Anti-Glare LED back).
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Construction Engineering Technician Program T161 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context:
The Angelo DelZotto School of Construction Management at George Brown College offers a program with a 1920 x 1080 FHD display having a size of .6 inches (15.24 cm) and 300nits brightness, an IPS Anti-Glare LED backlit screen, and a refresh rate of 144Hz. The college recommends against purchasing a Mac laptop due to compatibility issues with certain programs.

Domestic students should apply through Ontario Colleges, while international students must apply via the George Brown College Online Application System. Contact information for the Angelo DelZotto School of Construction Management includes a phone number (416-415-5000, ext. 4398) and email address (construction_eng@georgebrown.ca). Their office hours are from 8 a.m. to 4 p.m., room E228.

Additionally, interested individuals can attend on-campus information sessions or explore related programs such as Construction Engineering Technology (T105), Civil Engineering Technology (T164), and the Honours Bachelor of Technology (Construction Management) (T312). Campus tours can be booked for a more in-depth look.

International students seeking additional information or assistance from George Brown College recruitment representatives may do so by booking a virtual meeting or submitting an inquiry on the International Contact Us page. Prospective students are encouraged to sign up for tailored resources and email communications from the college.
